transcript.title: KING HUSSEIN
transcript.content:
On receiving news of the death of King Hussein of Jordan, I have today

sent the following message of condolence to the Prime Minister of

Jordan:

I was deeply saddened to hear of the death of His Majesty King

Hussein after a long and courageous battle with cancer. On behalf

of all Australians, I wish to offer my profound condolences to

the royal family, the government of Jordan and the Jordanian people.

King Hussein's death is a great loss to Jordan, the Middle

East and the world. He brought vision and perseverance to the

pursuit of peace in the Middle East. His role in the region's

efforts to come to terms with its deep problems is truly historic.

He dedicated himself unstintingly. The conclusion of the 1994

peace treaty between Jordan and Israel and the part he played

in achieving the Wye River accord are lasting testament to his

personal abilities and standing.

King Hussein's 47-year reign was marked by the strong and

open relationship he enjoyed with his people. They held a genuine

and profound affection for their King.

He will be deeply mourned by Jordanians and we share in your grief

at his passing.
